title: A1708 820-00840 with buzzing sound
message: This 820-00840 board had liquid damage, mostly in the area of the USB-C circuitry. I replaced some corroded resistors and the machine starts up and functions normally. Except that any time an audio signal is produced, the left speaker buzzes audibly for a few seconds, then goes quiet. Startup chime, system alert sound, any audio will produce the temporary buzz. Any pointers as to where I should look?

title: A1708 820-00840 with buzzing sound
message:
Audio amplifiers are near the USB-C area.
There must be corrosion.

title: A1708 820-00840 with buzzing sound
message: Yup, you're right. Upon closer inspection, the liquid damage extended to left speaker amplifiers. I see some potentially corroded capacitors and inductances. Any tips on troubleshooting an audio circuit?

title: A1708 820-00840 with buzzing sound
message:
I use JBC NASE-2 to work in such area.
You also need to resolder the chip, or change it.

title: A1708 820-00840 with buzzing sound
message: I removed the corroded U6420 and the buzzing is gone. Since this audio amplifier seems extremely hard to find, I decided to leave it as it is. Since there are 2 speakers on each side, I can barely hear the difference with one of the four nonfunctional.
